decks.notes: The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Creeping Chill, Prized Amalgam, and Bloodghast using cards such as Cathartic Reunion and Shriekhorn. By dredging cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, the deck can bring back creatures from the graveyard and create a strong board presence. Life from the Loam helps to return lands to hand to fuel the dredge engine. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of creatures and recurring damage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. By using Eldrazi Temple and the Urza lands, the deck aims to cast its threats ahead of schedule and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The inclusion of Mystic Forge and Wurmcoil Engine provides additional value and versatility, while cards like All Is Dust and Blast Zone offer removal options against various threats. Ultimately, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to deal as much damage as quickly as possible to the opponent using aggressive red creatures and direct damage spells. By playing fast and overwhelming the opponent with low-cost spells and efficient creatures, the deck aims to end the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. Cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel put pressure on the opponent early on, while burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm help finish the game.

This deck focuses on efficient removal spells and disruptive cards to control the opponent while quickly putting pressure on them with powerful creatures. The goal is to dominate the board early on with aggressive plays and deny the opponent the opportunity to stabilize. The deck also makes strategic use of its land cards to generate constant value and card advantage. By combining strong removal, disruptive spells, and powerful threats, this deck aims to assert dominance and overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced and aggressive manner.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by using low-cost spells and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards such as Boros Charm, Searing Blaze, and Lightning Bolt, the goal is to apply constant pressure and finish the game as fast as possible. The deck features a mix of burn spells, aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, and lands that help ensure a consistent mana base. The strategy is to maintain a fast-paced tempo, punishing opponents for any slow starts or misplays.

This Aggro Jund deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay to control the board while deploying powerful threats such as Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while generating card advantage with cards like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. With a mix of versatile threats and powerful disruption spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on disruption, removal, and card advantage in order to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's game plan, combined with removal spells like Fatal Push and Path to Exile, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while deploying threats like Stoneforge Mystic and Dark Confidant to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Lingering Souls provides additional value and resilience, making the deck difficult to deal with.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder to reach Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan. By using Scapeshift, you can sacrifice lands to search for more Mountains and deal a huge amount of damage to your opponent. With Mwonvuli Acid-Moss and Hour of Promise, you can disrupt your opponent's mana base and create additional threats with Field of the Dead. The deck aims to win the game through a powerful combo of landfall triggers and massive amounts of direct damage.

The main focus of this Modern aggro deck is fast, efficient damage dealing to quickly close out games. Utilizing a mix of burn spells and creatures with haste, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, allowing the deck to consistently cast its spells and keep up the pressure. Overall, this deck is designed to win games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The mana base is designed to support this strategy, with cards like Inspiring Vantage and Sunbaked Canyon providing the necessary mana to cast spells and keep up the pressure. The goal is to finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana and card advantage in order to cast a large number of spells in a single turn and win the game through a combo involving cards like Grapeshot. By utilizing cards such as Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce spell costs, along with rituals like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, the player aims to chain together spells and generate a lethal storm count. Gifts Ungiven is used to tutor for combo pieces, while cantrips like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand help dig for key cards.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures in the form of Humans, taking advantage of synergy between them and utilizing cards like Aether Vial to quickly deploy threats. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Kitesail Freebooter and Meddling Mage, while buffing up your own creatures with Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro strategy, supported by disruptive elements and mana acceleration.

The deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy while generating card advantage with cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Liliana of the Veil. Wrenn and Six provide additional value by recurring lands and filling the graveyard for Tarmogoyf. The threat of Bloodbraid Elf allows for explosive turns, and the use of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize disrupts the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruption to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Merfolk deck is to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck consists of low-cost Merfolk creatures and cards that support their abilities, such as increasing their power and toughness. Cards like Merfolk Mistbinder and Master of the Pearl Trident help boost the team's strength, while Merfolk Trickster and Harbinger of the Tides provide disruption and control options. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, making it easier to outpace the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this Modern Merfolk deck is to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful Merfolk creatures. By utilizing cards like Merfolk Mistbinder and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the team's power and toughness, alongside disruptive cards like Merfolk Trickster and Harbinger of the Tides to control the opponent's board, the deck aims to establish dominance early in the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment and the potential to surprise the opponent with instant-speed plays.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. By searching for lands and ramping up mana quickly, the deck aims to reach the critical mass of Mountains needed to trigger Valakut's ability multiple times in a single turn. Additionally, cards like Explore and Mwonvuli Acid-Moss help to accelerate the mana base and ensure the combo can be executed efficiently. The deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden burst of damage from landfall triggers.
